giftList.name: Vitruvi stone diffuser
giftList.description: Give their new apartment an aromatic makeover.

giftList.name: Beast blender & hydration system
giftList.description: The best smoothie, we've always maintained, is the one you make at home. Beast's blender can do it all—its compact build takes up less counter space than its competitors, it's powerful enough to chop any food ingredients you throw its way, and it boasts a portable bottle to take the finished product on the go. Oh, and the super photogenic design doesn't hurt either.

giftList.name: Fujifilm Instax SQ1 instant camera
giftList.description: So they can document it all.

giftList.name: Bose portable home Bluetooth speaker
giftList.description: Now that they're out of the house, they can play their music as loud as they want to.

giftList.name: Our Place home cook duo
giftList.description: A cookware twofer that handles most of the cooking needs you could conceivably have in a tiny apartment.

giftList.name: Trade Coffee subscription
giftList.description: For those last minute deadlines and adrenaline-fueled days, they'll always need more coffee. This subscription of the good stuff ensures that their bean supplies are always topped up.

giftList.name: Smythson passport cover
giftList.description: For all of the stamps they'll rack up on their post-grad adventures.

giftList.name: Artifact Uprising everyday photo book
giftList.description: If you're going the sentimental route, Artifact Uprising makes some of the best-looking scrapbooks for stuffing with all the school photos and memorabilia.

giftList.name: East Fork "you're all set" 7-piece set
giftList.description: All of the sleek ceramics that a person wants to pad out their dorm or first sublet.

giftList.name: 'Atomic Habits,' by James Clear
giftList.description: Some would say it's life-changing for getting your shit together.

giftList.name: Ssense x Nate Cotterman low wobble flow decanter
giftList.description: Cleveland-based glass studio Nate Cotterman teamed up with Ssense to give the classic decanter a makeover. The color, the shape, the wobbly base—it’s a happy little design, the kind of thing you see at your favorite achingly hip restaurant.

giftList.name: Aesop Aganice Aromatique candle
giftList.description: When you gift a candle, you want to make sure the vessel is just as special as the scent. This vegan candle—which smells of tobacco, mimosa, and cardamom—has a quote from Margaret Cavendish around the interior brim. It’s perfect for the sibling who makes fun of your parent’s “Live, Love, Laugh” decor with you.

giftList.name: Areaware x Simone Brewster strata plant vessel
giftList.description: Planters are a pretty safe bet since they come in all colors and shapes. This one is inspired by London-based designer Simone Brewster's sculptural pieces (meaning not just a.

giftList.name: Gohar World x Casa Bosques Valentine's Day bundle
giftList.description: Casa Bosques and Gohar World (i.e. chef Laila Gohar and her artist sister Nadia Gohar) have teamed up again for a limited run of three hand-wrapped heirloom chocolate bars featuring ingredients like slow-roasted hazelnut and preserved orange.

giftList.name: Wahine Honolulu ash tray
giftList.description: Sure, an Hermès catch-all would be nice, but Wahine's rainbow ash tray will lend an element of Hawaii's laid-back surf and skate culture to their living room.

giftList.name: Unifrom cassis perfume oil
giftList.description: Why not get the perfume that's as nuanced as your situationship? Unifrom's Stockholm-born and Grasse-made cassis roll-on scent deliciously blends plum, fig, and sandalwood.

giftList.name: Protogér Dermal serum
giftList.description: A beauty editor-beloved hydrating serum that perks up your skin with a double-shot of vitamin C and coffee seed extract.

giftList.name: Epi Logic True Calm Rosehip cleanser
giftList.description: Because skin barrier care should be its own love language.

giftList.name: 'Ghetto Gastro Presents Black Power Kitchen'
giftList.description: Ghetto Gastro, a Bronx-based culinary collective who have worked with the likes of Nike and Beats by Dre, are dipping deep into their cultural history and travel log to share 75 mostly plant-based recipes that include tweaks on family recipes to dishes from the African diaspora.

giftList.name: Uni body wash and serum set
giftList.description: Screw single-use plastic. This carbon-neutral set comes with two reusable dispensers and aluminum refills of face-grade body wash and hydrating serum.

giftList.name: Vacation Classic Whip SPF 30 sunscreen mousse
giftList.description: Looks like a gag gift, but actually works: Cheeky SPF mousse in a can that's enhanced with a signature sunny scent from the famed Arquiste Parfumeur.

giftList.name: Sarah Espeute Chemin de Champagne Runner

giftList.name: UrbanStems peony arrangement

You'll find plants like orchids for Valentine's Day, but UrbanStems makes an especially righteous bouquet—nothing like those wilted grocery store bundles. It offers same-day and next-day shipping, but arrangements tend to sell out pretty quickly here, so keep an eye out. Plus, as an

giftList.name: Benchmark Bouquets charming roses and alstroemeria with vase
giftList.description: Oh, Amazon, what don't you sell? In case you weren't aware, you can get bouquets overnighted (so long as you've got a Prime account) from the 'Zon, even if you're shopping at the eleventh hour. Flowers go out next day, Monday through Thursday, as long as you order before 10 a.m. ET, but there are no deliveries Saturday through Monday. And while you're at the online megastore, you may as well throw in some other goodies so your Valentine doesn't, er, think, you waited until the very last minute to find their gift.

giftList.name: Roses Only bright pink roses gift box (18 count)
giftList.description: Roses Only is meticulous about sourcing its stock—only via farms positioned 8,000 above sea level—so you know your Valentine's Day roses will be stunners. It offers same-day delivery in San Diego and New York City, plus next-day shipping nationwide for a fee.

giftList.name: Terrain fresh poppy bunch
giftList.description: Terrain's delicate arrangements—think branches and wild-foraged bouquets—are perfect for anyone who's into interior design. Items ship directly from a greenhouse Monday through Thursday, like this springtime-ready bunch of 80 Icelandic poppy stems.

giftList.name: Farm Girl Flowers vase, vase baby midi
giftList.description: Farmgirl Flowers sources from local farms using sustainable practices so its edited assortment of beautiful flowers is always changing—but it's always good—and the arrangements come beautifully presented. Order a seasonal mixed bouquet in the largest size and you've won Valentine's Day. Just enter your zip code to find out what shipping availability looks like.

giftList.name: Postal Petals beanie box
giftList.description: If your Valentine loves arranging their own flowers

giftList.name: H.Bloom blush bombshell
giftList.description: H.Bloom gets high marks for presentation. Most of its bouquets—even those under $100—come delivered in a modern glass vase. Keep in mind that there's no express shipping option here, so plan wisely.

giftList.name: Afloral hydrangea arrangement
giftList.description: For the practical Valentine who prefers a longer-lasting bloom, consider a dried arrangement like this hydrangea arrangement from Afloral. It's not a regular flower delivery service, but Afloral does offer expedited shipping if you wanted to speed up the process.

giftList.name: ‘Steven Klein,’ by Steven Klein
giftList.description: Steven Klein is one of the last standing godfathers of fashion photography (and most recently photographed Zoë Kravitz for the

giftList.name: ‘un/Masked,’ by Elizaveta Porodina
giftList.description: Elizaveta Porodina, who transitioned from a clinical psychologist to surrealist portrait photographer, has published a debut book that is a rolling landscape of dark, romantic pictures that transcend fashion and beauty portraiture. A longtime

giftList.name: ‘Tears and Tearsheets,’ by Katie Grand
giftList.description: If the pictures in Katie Grand’s enormous career retrospective anthology look familiar to you, it’s probably because everyone you follow on Instagram has pulled something from Grand’s ouevre for their moodboards. Thumbing through the raw scanned spreads feels like reading a mega-magazine that combines all the coolest editorials from 90s and 2000s style bibles like

giftList.name: ‘Amiri Wes Lang,’ by Hart Leshkina
giftList.description: This massive collection meticulously documents Amiri’s Fall Winter 2022 collection in collaboration with artist Wes Lang. Photography duo Hart Lëshkina spent months documenting every aspect of the creative process, including pictures of the sketches to studies of Lang’s hand-painted garments in his studio in LA to behind the scenes reportage of the runway show. It’s a fascinating 360-degree view of the intimate details that make up the collaboration between artist and fashion designer.

giftList.name: ‘Acid House As It Happened,’ by Dave Swindells
giftList.description: Sometimes you just want to look at good, old, pre-cell phone collections of nightlife photography. Dark, dirty, sweaty, dancing, candid, and not a bit of self-conscious posing in sight.
